## Matrix class

Class used to store matrix data (4x4)

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare class Matrix 
```

## Constructors

|  Constructor | Modifiers | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  [(constructor)()](./decentraland-ecs.matrix.(constructor).md) |  | Creates an empty matrix (filled with zeros) |

## Properties

|  Property | Modifiers | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- | --- |
|  [IdentityReadOnly](./decentraland-ecs.matrix.identityreadonly.md) | <code>static</code> | <code>Readonly&lt;Matrix&gt;</code> | Gets an identity matrix that must not be updated |
|  [m](./decentraland-ecs.matrix.m.md) |  | <code>Readonly&lt;FloatArray&gt;</code> | Gets the internal data of the matrix |
|  [updateFlag](./decentraland-ecs.matrix.updateflag.md) |  | <code>number</code> | Gets the update flag of the matrix which is an unique number for the matrix. It will be incremented every time the matrix data change. You can use it to speed the comparison between two versions of the same matrix. |

|  [DecomposeLerpToRef(startValue, endValue, gradient, result)](./decentraland-ecs.matrix.decomposelerptoref.md) | <code>static</code> | Update a matrix to values which are computed by: \* decomposing the the "startValue" and "endValue" matrices into their respective scale, rotation and translation matrices \* interpolating for "gradient" (float) the values between each of these decomposed matrices between the start and the end \* recomposing a new matrix from these 3 interpolated scale, rotation and translation matrices |
